One problem with using mirrors or lenses to collect light onto photovoltaics is that as they get hotter it affects their output. There certainly are solar collection designs that rely on arrays of mirrors to concentrate light, but usually you're talking about solar thermal power generation rather than photovoltaics.

Plus you have to actively steer these mirrors, which adds complexity, cost, bulk, and weight. Whereas with just a PV panel you find a "good enough" spot and you leave the low-profile panel there.

Well cats kill about 3 billion birds per annum in the US, whereas wind turbines kill about 300,000, so 10,000 birds killed by cats by every one killed by a wind turbine.

There are 49,000 wind turbines in the US, which means each turbine kills about 6 birds per year.

There are up to 100 million domestic cats in the US, which means each cat kills about 30 birds per year.

Your average cat is about 5 times more lethal than your average turbine, and significantly worse at generating electricity!
